name: (R) ESTAR GSHP (Other Fossil Furnace)
_description: ENERGY STAR ground source heat pump fully replacing original fuel oil/propane furnace

notes: 2022 ENERGY STAR v3.2 performance level residential ground:source heat pumps

source_data.title: Residential Demand Module of the National Energy Modeling System: Model Documentation 2014

notes: Total installed cost for ENERGY STAR GSHPs in 2022 (assume in new buildings, full installation cost is incurred to represent cost of drilling)
For existing buildings, additional tank removal costs of 800 2014$ (1030 2023$) are applied for distillate and propane based on the 2015 EIA report, updating the cost from April 2014 to April 2022.
installed_cost_source.source_data: Buildings Annual Technology Baseline. NREL, forthcoming

product_lifetime_source.notes: Average of the ENERGY STAR range

source_data.title: Updated Buildings Sector Appliance and Equipment Costs and Efficiencies
source_data.author: U.S. Energy Information Administration

market_scaling_fractions_source.notes: Heating multiples were determined as proportion of total homes with non-NG fossil-based heating that have both cooling and heating systems in each BA climate zone. Cooling multiple of 8% was determined as a proportion of total homes with a cooling system (16,171 homes) where there is heating via a heating energy source other than natural gas, electricity, or biomass AND heating is done via non:steam/hot water system (1,338 homes).
